events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
Loan application was reviewed and categorised as a Personal Loan given the stated use for medical and debt expenses.
A loan officer with experience in personal loans was assigned to manage the case and assist the applicant.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the applicant's submitted information including income and credit history.
Additional documents were requested from the applicant, including recent bank statements and medical bills for verification.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents to support the loan application requirements.
Credit history and score review were completed and showed a moderate risk profile with no recent defaults.
Risk evaluation was performed to assess the likelihood of repayment based on financial and personal factors.
A loan offer with competitive terms and reasonable interest rates was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant provided feedback indicating willingness to proceed but requested a slightly longer repayment term.
The application was escalated to senior management for approval of the extended repayment term requested by the applicant.
The loan application was approved with the adjusted repayment schedule and terms accepted by the applicant.
Funds were disbursed successfully to the applicant's designated bank account for intended personal use.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant understood loan terms and to answer any post-funding questions.
The loan application process was formally closed after all requirements were met and documentation finalised.
